name: Vegan Key Lime Pie Ice Cream
description: This vegan key lime pie ice cream is a play on my favorite Mexican dessert, carlota de limón. (In Mexico it is also known as pay de limón ice cream.) A tangy and sweet key lime-coconut milk base is churned until it is light and creamy and then mixed with crumbled Maria cookies.
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup Fresh key lime juice or regular lime juice
½ cup Crumbled Maria cookies (see note)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the coconut milk, lime juice, sugar, and agave nectar in the blender and process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the coconut milk, lime juice, sugar, and agave nectar in the blender and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the mixture cool in the refrigerator for at least two hours, preferably overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the mixture cool in the refrigerator for at least two hours, preferably overnight.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the mixture is cold, add it to your ice cream machine and churn according to the machine’s instructions. It could take anywhere from 15 to 25 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the mixture is cold, add it to your ice cream machine and churn according to the machine’s instructions. It could take anywhere from 15 to 25 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: During the last couple of minutes of churning add the crumbled cookies to the ice cream.
recipeInstructions.name: During the last couple of minutes of churning add the crumbled cookies to the ice cream.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the ice cream (it will look like soft-serve a freezer-safe container with a lid and freeze for at least 5 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the ice cream (it will look like soft-serve a freezer-safe container with a lid and freeze for at least 5 hours.

keywords: coconut milk, key lime, maria cookies
